analytic.title: A Medieval Sufi Thecla? Female Civic and Spiritual Leadership in ‘Attār’s “Tale of the Virtuous Woman” and the Life and Passion of Eugenia

monogr.title: Thecla and Medieval Sainthood: The Acts of Paul and Thecla in Eastern and Western Hagiography

body.bibl: Dabiri, Ghazzal. “A Medieval Sufi Thecla? Female Civic and Spiritual Leadership in ‘Attār’s ‘Tale of the Virtuous Woman’ and the Life and Passion of Eugenia.” In Thecla and Medieval Sainthood: The Acts of Paul and Thecla in Eastern and Western Hagiography, edited by Ghazzal Dabiri and Flavia Ruani, 282–317. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2022.

Ghazzal Dabiri, A Medieval Sufi Thecla? Female Civic and Spiritual Leadership in ‘Attār’s ‘Tale of the Virtuous Woman’ and the Life and Passion of Eugenia,” in Thecla and Medieval Sainthood: The Acts of Paul and Thecla in Eastern and Western Hagiography, ed. Ghazzal Dabiri and Flavia Ruani (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2022), 282–317.
